definition: to be jealous of (sb's achievements etc)/to be envious/envy

sentences.english: Latty made little of Jane's new dress because she was jealous.
sentences.chinese: 拉蒂看不起簡的新裙子，困爲她很妒嫉。

sentences.english: He finds it difficult to hide envy of his brother's success.
sentences.chinese: 他很難掩飾對自己兄弟成功的妒嫉。

sentences.english: The person with great envy has strong ambitions and delights in intrigue.
sentences.chinese: 大妒嫉者，野心熾盛，並以機狡爲樂。

sentences.english: I hate it you can swim so well and I can't.
sentences.chinese: 我妒嫉你游泳那麼好，而我不能。

sentences.english: King Saul tries to kill David in a fit of anger because of jealousy by throwing a spear.
sentences.chinese: 掃羅王因爲妒嫉，在怒氣中要用槍殺死大衛。

sentences.english: To peaceful arts shall envy bow.

definition: to be jealous of (sb's achievements etc)/to be envious/envy
to hate out of jealousy/to resent
variant of 憤恨|愤恨[fen4 hen4]
to admire/to hold in high esteem
to resent/to harbor a grudge against/to loathe/resentment/rancor
to feel hatred/to harbor a grudge
to hate and resent/angry and full of grievances
to view sb as an enemy/to be hateful towards
